column4: i asked in #ubuntu-irc a while ago about finding a replacement method for !clone (as it uses aptitude) but alternatives where all deemed dangerous/sub-optimal.  So aptitude still has a use on ubuntu ;)
not only do you need to chroot but also do you need to bind mount proc, sys and temp into the chrooted installation in order to have grub do its job
which is all documented in the !grub2 chroot option ;)
